accused.name: Claudatte veuve Michel Demenge Antoine
accused.spouse_name: Michiel Demenge Anthoine (dit vulgairement de la Haulte Robbe)

confession.seduction_context: upset at great 'cher temps' (hard times), frightened of being in want - Persin assured her he would aid her and that she would never want
powder_types: healing powder (cooked with une hostie sacrée and eggs)
sabbat_activities: present at making of great hailstorm of St. Jean in 1589

witnesses.name: Jean Pierrat
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: she wanted him to marry one of her daughters

witnesses.name: Mengeon Wanier
witnesses.location: Trois Maisons faulbourg de St. Dié

testimony.quarrel_subject: several quarrels, including horse damaging her 'pave'

testimony.threat_quote: qu'est ce que ceste vielle sorciere cherchoit ceste part, sy tard

testimony.quarrel_subject: lost chappelet which Claudatte's daughter wore; maimbour went to law to recover it
testimony.threat_quote: en murmura bien fort, et la menaca

testimony.quarrel_subject: hen which Claudatte and her daughter had stolen from witness

witnesses.name: Jehennon femme Colas du Haud
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: her late husband was 'd'elle assez familiaire'

witnesses.name: Gilles Padoux
witnesses.occupation: lieutenant de bailly à St Dié

testimony.quarrel_subject: animals strayed into field sown with oats belonging to Claudatte's daughter
testimony.threat_quote: qu'avant qu'il fut quatre jours, qu'elle s'en repentiroit
qu'avant qu'il fut quatre jours, qu'elle s'en repentiroit

witnesses.name: Francois Petit Demenge
witnesses.occupation: substitut du Procureur General de Lorraine à St. Dié

timeline.subject: Claudatte Antoine
timeline.details: Confrontations with witnesses, generally denied all charges

timeline.subject: Claudatte Antoine
timeline.details: Change de Nancy orders torture, but only so she should 'ung peu sentir les gresillons'

timeline.subject: Claudatte Antoine
timeline.details: Interrogation under torture - thumbscrews on feet then hands, confessed after release

timeline.subject: Claudatte Antoine
timeline.details: Repeated all confessions, complete list of crimes and accomplices

timeline.subject: Claudatte Antoine
timeline.details: Change de Nancy passes death sentence, subject to repetition of earlier avowals

timeline.subject: Claudatte Antoine
timeline.details: Retracted confessions, said she told untruths under torture

timeline.subject: Claudatte Antoine
timeline.details: Change de Nancy orders further torture

timeline.subject: Claudatte Antoine
timeline.details: Renewed confessions, saying she had been 'maladvisée et malconseillée'

timeline.subject: Claudatte Antoine
timeline.details: Repeated avowals - final confirmation before execution

torture.restrictions: only so she should 'ung peu sentir les gresillons' (feel the thumbscrews a little)

accomplices_named.name: Georgeatte wife of Claudon Prevost des battues, previously wife of Jean Francois
Babillon dite la Grand Commere cy-devant femme de Bastien Ozelle
L'hospitalliere du Viel Marché nommée Mengeotte femme a Jean l'Allemand
woman of le Viel Marché (name missing)
wife of Colas Curien du Faing
La grande Commine veuve Bastien Ozelle

prior_accusations.context: identified Claudatte as accomplice (Claudatte denied knowing her)
made accusation against her day before first torture

notable_quotes.speaker: Claudon Durant (witness 7)
notable_quotes.french: qu'est ce que ceste vielle sorciere cherchoit ceste part, sy tard
notable_quotes.english: what is this old witch looking for here, so late
notable_quotes.context: said when Claudatte passed near him and his fiancée late one evening

notable_quotes.speaker: Claudatte's daughter (via witness 17)
notable_quotes.french: qu'avant qu'il fut quatre jours, qu'elle s'en repentiroit
notable_quotes.english: within four days, she would repent
notable_quotes.context: threat after animals strayed into field of oats

notable_quotes.speaker: Claudatte Antoine
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle l'a cogneu pour ung homme qui disoit le bien et faisoit le mal, et prenoit ce que luy n'appartenoit
notable_quotes.english: she knew him for a man who said good things and did evil, and took what did not belong to him

notable_quotes.speaker: Claudatte Antoine
notable_quotes.french: A commencé en cest endroict a mauldire et maulgreer tous ceux et celles, qui eurent oncques communication aux malings, et que dampné soient ceulx qui luy imposent telles faulcetes et crimes
notable_quotes.english: began at this point to curse all those who ever had communication with evil spirits, and damned be those who impose such falsehoods and crimes upon her

notable_quotes.speaker: Claudatte Antoine
notable_quotes.french: que pour neant luy impute l'on venefice, parce que s'elle eut esté telle, Il y a longtemps qu'elle eut fait mourir son gendre, qui luy at tant faict de mal
notable_quotes.english: that it is pointless to impute witchcraft to her, because if she were such, she would long ago have killed her son-in-law, who has done her so much harm

notable_quotes.speaker: Claudatte Antoine
notable_quotes.french: et sy elle est sorciere tout le monde l'est
notable_quotes.english: and if she is a witch then everyone is

notable_quotes.speaker: Claudatte Antoine
notable_quotes.french: que pleut a Dieu, que nous sachons aussy bien qu'elle la verité, qu'elle n'est sorciere, et que s'elle est sorciere, le diable la puisse emporter et eslever a la veue de tout le monde hault en l'air
notable_quotes.english: may it please God that we know as well as she the truth, that she is not a witch, and if she is a witch, may the devil carry her away and lift her high in the air in view of everyone

notable_quotes.speaker: Nicolas Miclin (via witness 19)
notable_quotes.context: called her this several times, accusing her of causing death of his wife and children

notable_quotes.speaker: Woman (wife of Bastien des Aulx, via Claudatte)
notable_quotes.french: qu'en malle santé puisse il geser, que jamais homme n'avoit mis son marit au somme
notable_quotes.english: may he lie in bad health, for no man had ever imprisoned her husband
notable_quotes.context: cursing the curé Nicolas for imprisoning her husband

relationships.evidence_text: widow of Michiel Demenge Anthoine 'dit vulgairement de la Haulte Robbe'
multiple references to Claudatte's daughter throughout testimony
Claudatte's daughter was married to Colas Mengeat du Viel Marché
son-in-law came to foot of tower and called out 'qu'elle ait bon courage'
His late wife had languished miserably for 4 or 5 years before her death
As nearest neighbour he had also had sickness
her late husband was 'd'elle assez familiaire'
His late wife had languished miserably for several years

economic_context.details: Quarrel over chappelet (rosary) which her daughter allegedly wore; maimbour went to law to recover it. Also property confiscation fears related to her husband standing as 'caution et respondant' for Noel des Aulx. Moved property during his imprisonment fearing confiscation.

harms_catalog.harm_description: languished in extremity of illness, bewitched
harms_catalog.method_alleged: bread and ashes from Claudatte's house sought as counter-magic

harms_catalog.harm_description: languished miserably for 4 or 5 years before death

harms_catalog.economic_value: losses amounting to over 200 francs in a year

harms_catalog.harm_description: sickness, not yet able to celebrate Mass
marital discord - could not see each other, fought and quarreled daily, without least affection
languished miserably for several years before death
harms_catalog.method_alleged: Claudatte 'en murmura bien fort, et la menaca'

harms_catalog.harm_description: illness lasting a year before death
harms_catalog.method_alleged: identified by religieux de Haulteseille as cause

harms_catalog.harm_description: fell ill (cured by eating Claudatte's cheese, bread and salt)

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: animals strayed into daughter's field of oats
he brought his pigs to market

harms_catalog.harm_description: given powder in glass of wine
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: he wanted to abuse her daughter and had already impregnated her chambermaid
harms_catalog.method_alleged: powder in wine at banquet des femmes
powder given to chambermaid, some fell on child

sought from Claudatte's house as counter-magic for curé's illness
sought from Claudatte's house as counter-magic

given with cheese and bread to Nicolas Miclin

weather_events: great hailstorm of St. Jean in 1589
economic_hardship_indicators: cher temps (hard times) - Claudatte said seduction occurred when upset at great 'cher temps' and frightened of being in want
religious_calendar_references: St. Jean (feast day when hailstorm occurred in 1589)

prior_legal_disputes.description: maimbour of Jacot Bergier's wife went to law to recover chappelet from Claudatte's daughter

legal_context.redress_outcome: would have taken action against curé Nicolas for accusations but he moved away from parish
legal_context.imprisonment_conditions: son-in-law came to foot of tower by night and called out encouragement

change_de_nancy.modification_details: 2 October 1592: ordered torture but only so she should 'ung peu sentir les gresillons' (feel thumbscrews a little). 12 October 1592: passed death sentence subject to repetition of confessions. 17 October 1592: ordered further torture after retraction.

hearsay_chains.content: curé languished in extremity of illness and was bewitched by Claudatte
first wife died after being bewitched by Claudatte

hearsay_chains.source: observation during Noel des Aulx trial
hearsay_chains.content: Claudatte fled and was joyful when Noel didn't accuse anyone

emotional_state_notes: cursed all those who had communication with evil spirits during interrogation
proclaimed she was good Christian with sacrament of confirmation
said if she were witch she would have killed son-in-law who harmed her
retracted confession saying she told untruths under torture
invoked God to prove innocence, saying devil should carry her away if she's witch

reproaches_to_witnesses.objection: wife of Jean Pierat was not in her right mind; he had sought alliance to marry her daughter, not the reverse
Mengeon Wanier is 'terrible teste d'homme' (terrible-headed man); he beat his horse too much
daughter bought chappelet for 9 gros from one Challatte; girl was ill before marriage anyway
curé Nicolas 'said good things and did evil, took what didn't belong to him'; his boys took from gardens; woman (wife of Bastien des Aulx) cursed him for imprisoning her husband

third_parties.relationship_to_accused: curé who she said did evil
third_parties.context: held parish of St. Martin at Viel Marché previous year, his illness attributed to Claudatte

third_parties.name: brother of curé Nicolas
third_parties.context: was at Viel Marché last year, now promoted to cure of Remenoville, seeking counter-magic from Claudatte's house

third_parties.context: accused her day before first torture; also named as accomplice seen at sabbat

third_parties.context: who 'court presentement les champs' (runs through the fields), allegedly sold chappelet to Claudatte's daughter

third_parties.name: Bastien Jean Myatte
third_parties.context: took 'couge de bacon' from Claudatte's house, said perhaps she would be arrested

extraction_metadata.notes: Comprehensive 6-page trial record with 19 witnesses, extensive testimony about reputation (up to 27 years), multiple harms alleged, torture leading to confession which was retracted then renewed. Death sentence passed. Notable features include: counter-magic practices (seeking bread/salt/ashes from accused's house), consultation of multiple diviners, economic losses valued in ecus and francs, and rich detail about daily life and social relationships. Trial shows pattern of long-standing reputation followed by accumulation of specific harm allegations, torture-induced confession with accomplice naming, retraction, and final renewal before execution.
